news uk-news dogs-who-spent-entire-lives-"Dogs who spent whole lives shut inside crates embrace freedomByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsAfter spending their entire lives shut inside a create, two six-year-old dogs have been able to explore the outside world for the first time.Six-year-old poodle cross dogs Bella and Lila and were completely shut down when they were taken into the RSPCAaposs care.The charityaposs Martlesham Animal Centre, in Suffolk, took the pair in after their owner signed them over. Kennel supervisor Natalie Wood said: “Bella and Lila had led such restricted, sheltered lives and we believe they’d only had very limited time out of their crates, so theyaposd barely experienced the outside world.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. “Their coats were matted and dirty, tangled with urine and faeces. They had fleas, their nails were overgrown, their ears were thick with dirt and their teeth were covered in plaque. Both were displaying extremely fearful behaviours and we were unable to approach them or handle them. They were terried of everything and everyone.”Staff spent weeks gaining the girls’ trust, assessing them and developing rehabilitation plans to help prepare them for new homes.Natalie added: “It took two months until we were able to take Lila out for her first walk off the site, and a further month until Bella would venture outside the safety of the centre with us. That was a huge milestone for us. “After months of slow and gradual work we had a breakthrough in May when Lila, who’d developed a strong bond with our kennel assistant, Lucy, learned to rush over to her when she arrived at her kennel each morning and put her paws onto her shoulders asto give her a hug. It was a beautul moment.Lila - now renamed Jemima - was adopted by Deborah Turpin and her family, from Suffolk, to live with their eight-year-old retired racing greyhound, Sam. They were looking for another dog after losing their border terrier and spotted Jemima’s profile online. “Her video was heartbreaking and I just couldn’t get her out of my mind,” Deborah said. “What she’d been through was unimaginable and I knew we had to give her a chance. We decided to rename her as we wanted her to leave her old le, and her old name, behind her.” The family collected Jemima in October and set about helping her settle in her new home. “She is an absolute dream, she’s such a superstar,” Deborah added. “She has a wonderful personality and is so affectionate. She rushes up to us every morning to give us a cuddle she obviously has six years of cuddles to make up for! We had no idea we needed a little white curly-haired dog as much as we do! “The most enormous credit goes to the team at Martlesham who helped her after what she went through they instilled such confidence in her. We’re overwhelmed by the work that they did with her and how easy they’ve made the process for us. “Now Jemima is becoming quite cheeky and loves to spend time with us. She is so happy, has wonderful manners, and is very clever and eager to learn. She loved her first visit to the beach, enjoys going in the car, and had a fabulous first Christmas. “She is an absolute joy and embraces le with enormous enthusiasm. She has every reason to hate everybody, but she is so happy and is game for everything!” Bella, who was adopted by a family from Scotland, has also settled into her new home. Her new owner said: “Bella is doing really well we feel very fortunate to have her!”To help the RSPCA rescue more animals in need, like Bella and Jemima, please visit www.rspca.org.uk give to donate. To support the work of Martlesham Animal Centre - run by the Suffolk Central branch - please visit www.rspca-suffolkcentral.org.uk donate to make a donation.Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: family out 47000 after terrifying
story: Family lose £, after terrying sewage flood left flat furniture floatingGraphic designer David Benqué, , and his partner Claire OBrien, , say they lost £, worth of belongings and have since forked out £, when a freak flood destroyed their south London flatGraphic designer David Benqué, , and his partner Claire OBrien, , have spent nearly £, replacing damaged items Image: David Benqué My LondonByCallum CuddefordAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA family who said theyaposve lost £, after sewage flooded their home claim Thames Water have refused to compensate them. Graphic designer David Benqué, , and his partner Claire OaposBrien, , say they lost £, worth of belongings when a freak flood destroyed their south London flat. They claim they have since spent nearly £, replacing damaged items and relocating - bringing the total spent to £,. The couple says they are furious with Thames Water, who they claim gave them no compensation after a collapsed sewer caused the carnage in September .Thames Water refused legal liability because there were no previous issues with the sewer, therefore they claim they were not negligent, MyLondon reports.  Thames Water also reportedly asked the couple to sign a letter meaning they wonapost pay for aposun-restorableapos items. David and Claire say they refused to sign the letter and had to fork out £, to dispose of the wrecked belongings themselves. David said: I was alerted to the sound and the smell, something did not seem right. I saw a torrent of water. The pipe that exploded was under a bin so there was a bunch of rubbish floating.  I opened the door and saw the whole staircase was like a waterfall. I closed the door and for a couple of seconds, my brain said it would be fine. Then I knew it was not going to be okay so I woke my partner up. Once Claire was awake they grabbed the children, their teddies and put an iPad up high. David said he got his coat and laptop, but the computer later fell into the sludge.  David recalled: The water was coming through the door so we thought it was time to go out, then the door opened and let a torrent of sewage in. Our furniture started floating and then it got pretty intense.The fire brigade arrived as the water was filling the basement.David added: I was carrying my five-year-old, I saw the firefighters so I crawled so they could see us. They helped my partner who was carrying the three-year-old and she could not walk forward the pressure was so strong, so he was carried by a fireman.  The coupleaposs flat wasnapost the only one affected and other neighbours were rescued from their windows because the water pressure was so strong. By the next day, the extent of the damage could be seen and the costs started to mount up. Thames Water said the family was not eligible for the hardship fund. David said: We are lucky we have family and friends that are able to help us, but we are broke as hell now. There were lots of upsetting moments but when you walk into your flat and see a book your kidsapos like and itaposs covered in muck. You could see stuff that was familiar but itaposs all in the wrong place and everything is covered. Then we realised they were not going to give us any money at all. Textile designer Claire said: Now the time has passed it was actually a really traumatic event to be woken up to a torrent of water rushing into your home. The trauma of seeing how much water was in our flat, just filled up like a bath. Itaposs been really dficult just the devastation, the time and stress to get back on our feet and have nothing from Thames Water. We feel like criminals that do not matter when itaposs their pipe that exploded on our lives. A few hours earlier it could have been a very dferent story but it was still pretty terrying. The fact that it was sewage water, itaposs toxic. The kidsapos stuff is sentimental, they still talk about it all the time. It makes you think lots of people would not be able to get back on their feet. That really stuck with me, the utter devastation, everything gone within five minutes. Itaposs a terrible thing for your family to go through. Itaposs not our fault, or climate change, itaposs Thames Water. A Thames Water spokesperson told The Mirror: “We understand how distressing sewer flooding is and we sympathise with anyone affected. “In this case, the flooding was caused by a collapsed sewer which caused sewage to spill out into nearby properties. Our engineers were quickly on the scene and carried out repairs as a matter of urgency. Investigations show there were no previous issues with the sewer which would have contributed to the collapse, and as such Thames Water was not negligent and is not legally liable for the damage caused. “As with all sewer flooding, we offered to clean and sanitise affected properties, which includes removing belongings which are too damaged to be ed to the property. In order to do this, we ask our customers to sign a document acknowledging that we won’t be reimbursing them for the items removed. “We encourage anyone affected by the devastating impact of sewer flooding to make a claim through their home insurance provider.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Thames Water PLCiPadClimate changeHouse insuranceFloods" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates from our environment editor on green issues and actions you can takeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: how britains most wanted woman
story: Exclusive: How Britains most wanted woman evaded justice for nine years before being caughtSarah Panitzke vanished during her London trial for laundering £billion in a mobile phone VAT fraud. She then wore a wig to flee the Spanish villa where she had been under surveillance in Sarah Panitzke was caught after being on the run for nine years Image: PAByTom PettorCrime Editor:,  Mar  A British crook who fled police waiting to arrest her by disguising herself in a wig has finally been held after nine years on the run.Sarah Panitzke, , vanished during her  London trial for laundering £billion in a mobile phone VAT fraud.Two years later, she sneaked away from a Spanish bolthole as officers closed in. Panitzke was caught last Sunday as she walked her dogs in Santa Barbara, between ­Barcelona and Valencia. The head of the elite ­Fugitive Task Force squad which nabbed her told yesterday of her disguise and dramatic escape in . He said: “It was like ­something out of a film.  “She appeared by her door to smoke and one officer passed by to get a closer look. “She saw him and changed her clothes, donned a wig and a small rucksack before heading for the mountains beside the house a few moments later. “It’s very rare to find people as prepared as she was.” He revealed after her arrest Panitzke, who had been living under the alias Maria ­Antonietta, claimed she felt she had already done her time, having lived in isolation for so many years. The officer added: “She also complained she was only able to buy a cheap gin for her gin and tonics as her money started to run out.” Panitzke, of Fulford, North Yorks, was sentenced to eight years in her absence for the fraud. She is in prison near Madrid, fighting extradition. Told of her arrest, mum Pauline, , said at her home in Market Weighton, East Yorks: “At least I know she’s safe and well.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON SurveillanceCrimeDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: huge delays massive queues dublin
story: Huge delays and massive queues at Dublin and Manchester airports prompt passenger furyOne passenger at Manchester Airport said her flight to Gran Canaria with TUI left more than two hours late due to delays getting the luggage onto the planeHuge airport delays as massive queues at Dublin and Manchester airports Image: Clare OHanlon TwitterByAshlie BlakeyLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsFuming passengers have been hit by a second wave of delays at Manchester Airport where firefighters are helping to tackle mammoth queues. Fire crew have been asked to work on the baggage belts and travellers complained of massive lines at security that took hours to get through, it has been claimed.Queues at check-in desks were described as beyond a joke causing some people to miss their flights and leaving others in tears on Monday. It marked the second day of delays at the international hub amid staff shortages which saw some passengers stuck on the runway for two-and-a-half hours.One airport worker told the Manchester Evening News : “It’s been so bad that they have been asking firefighters, engineers and parking staff to offload the bags onto the conveyors in the arrivals hall. “I think the summer is going to be horrendous, at this rate we just won’t have the staff, and morale is already low. I just hope that we get the staff we need in time and get back to normal. One woman said her flight to Gran Canaria with TUI departed more than two hours late due to delays getting the baggage on the plane. Kathleen Moorland said she was still sitting on the plane on the runway at .pm, when it was meant to be departing at .am.She added that there were delays getting through queues at the airport, despite arriving more than three hours before her flight. Kathleen said: TUI and Manchester Airport, a total farce and joke. All you want is an easy start to your holiday - not the total chaos that there is. Julia Teale tweeted: @manairport. You really need to sort your staffing issues. Just witnessed people missing flights who have been here three hours but security was so disorganised it’s taking hours to get through. If it’s like this in March what will it be like in high season. Not enough staff.  Martijn van der Voort also tweeted: When will @manairport @AndyBurnhamGM @ManCityCouncil grasp that the airport is one of the worst in the world  From rude security staff to long queues to poor infrastructure and parking. Truly terrible airport and I have been to many across the globe. On Sunday, passengers were also faced with ridiculous two-hour queues amid a workforce shortage, sparking fears of more chaos for passengers in the busy summer ahead. It is estimated that more than , redundancies were made at Manchester Airport as the aviation sector was savaged by the pandemic. This included around  workers employed directly by the hub and more than , by outside employers like baggage handling agents and airlines.Now travel restrictions are lting, passenger numbers are on the rise and plans to reopen Terminal  are also in the pipeline. But questions have been raised as to whether the workforce can meet demand in what Manchester Airport bosses have described as an extremely challenging labour market. Airport bosses apologised over long delays and horrendous queues at passport control on Friday. A spokesperson for Manchester Airport said queues on both days were due to a greater number of passengers than expected. Passengers have been urged to get to the airport at least three hours before their scheduled flight time. A spokesperson for Swissport, which handles baggage for TUI, said: “We would like to apologise to those passengers who experienced baggage delays at Manchester Airport following an aircraft change which impacted our resource allocation. We have worked with our airport partners to remedy the delays and normal service has resumed. Thehas contacted Manchester Airport for further comment. title: landlord discovers giant 7ft snake
story: Landlord discovers giant ft snake hiding in piles of rubbish left by tenantsLandlord Phil Tewkesley said he found a massive seven feet boa constrictor as well as a scorpion and a tarantula amongst large piles of rubbish left behind by "hoarder" tenantsA landlord found his bungalow full of rubbish Image: Kennedy News and MediaBySam SmedleyRebecca CooleyTim Hanlon:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA landlord has told how he found a massive seven-feet boa constrictor along with another live snake and two dead, as well as a scorpion and a tarantula, after evicting tenants. Landlord Phil Tewkesley, , made the shocking discoveries after he was able to remove the occupants who he claimed had been refusing to go for months.When he finally was able to enter the bungalow he found it full of rubbish including the four snakes - two dead and two alive - fish, bugs crawling across the carpets and even a scorpion and tarantula, reported LancsLive. The tenant was allegedly an animal lover who had rescued the snakes and other creatures. The landlord has now shared shocking footage of the trashed home, near Kendal, and the abandoned creatures.  Phil, from Worsley, said: It was unbelievable, the sheer volume of not just belongings but actual rubbish and food. Iaposve never seen anything like it in my le - it was like a rubbish dump with a roof on it. The neighbours said they were hoarders - they got deliveries every day and never threw anything out. There was mould growing from the carpet and it was full of urine, mealworms - you name it, it was rotten. There was also evidence in a number of spots of rodent damage and a bit of an infestation with holes gnawed through places around the house. The daughteraposs room was the worst - my partner Lisa cleared that and had to run out of the house heaving and retching numerous times because of the stench of urine. I saw this huge tank and it was dirty. I looked a bit closer into the tank and got the shock of my le - there was this gigantic snake curled up.I was terried, I screamed and ran out of the house because the shock of seeing something like that was unbelievable. Phil issued a formal notice for the tenants to vacate the bungalow upon histo the UK in late , after living abroad for six years. But the couple, who lived in the property with their teen daughter, didnapost leave for another year, it is reported. Phil, an HR manager, gained access to his property in December last year and then made the grim discovery that the entire three-bedroom house was piled high with rubbish and housing both dead and live exotic animals. He phoned the RSPCA and left a spare key with the neighbours, allowing them to come and collect the aposgiganticapos snake. The RSPCA officers also called the police, who sent an officer to witness the recovery of the animals.Once they were removed, the locks were changed and the tenant was given a month to remove the rest of his belongings before the clean up could begin. It took the landlord, his partner Lisa McCartney, , and some friends around  stomach-churning hours to clear all of the rubbish and rip the soiled carpets out. Phil said: I initially hired three skips - at £ each - and we filled them in one day, followed by another two which were full to the brim as well. I also had to pay for the council to do a large collection of the sofa and kitchen appliances because they were rotten. It cost about £, just to get rid of their stuff and the stuff theyaposd wrecked and itaposs going to cost tens of thousands to get it back to how it should have been. Itaposs been a really stressful period, trying to get him to leave and then to find what I found. Weaposre getting married at the end of this year so itaposs something we really didnapost need to have to deal with. Phil, who said he felt the new rule, introduced due to Covid, of giving tenants six months to find somewhere new to live was aposfairapos, setting the vacation deadline at April .  But in January of that year, he got the first hint that something was wrong at the property when his application to release capital from the bungalow to help fund a new house deposit was rejected due to the state of the property. A spokesperson for the RSPCA said: We can confirm that four snakes - two sadly dead and two alive - were removed from a property in [Cumbria] by the RSPCA following a report from a member of the public. The live snakes were rehomed at a specialist boarding facility. As there is now a live investigation, we are not able to provide any further information at the moment. title: mothers day exact day changes
story: When is Mothers Day   Date and why the date changes every yearAs International Womens Day is celebrated across the globe through events and online campaigns, some people are being reminded that Mothers Day is also not very far away tooInternational Womens Day has reminded a few people of Mothers Day, which is coming round again soon Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Mar |comments With International Womenaposs Day being celebrated across the world, people are being reminded that Motheraposs Day is also looming.Believe it or not, some people seem to have the two confused as people are reminded of the impact of womenaposs achievements through the centuries and how there is still a way to go to achieving gender equality. With the focus of the day on this, it is no wonder that some people have been reminded that Mothering Sunday is only around the corner, as people looking forward to showing their appreciation for their mum and everything she has done for them So when is Motheraposs Day  When is Motheraposs Day   Motheraposs Day this year falls on Sunday, March . The term aposMotheraposs Dayapos technically means the day dedicated to the celebration of mums everywhere, whereas Mothering Sunday tended to refer to a Christian tradition that began in the th century where people would visit either the church they grew up in or were baptised.  The dates for the next few years are as follows: - March   - March   - March   - March Why does the Motheraposs Day date change   The celebration falls on the fourth Sunday in Lent and the date changes depending on Easter and the Christian calendar. Easter and Lent changes every year depending on the cycle of the moon and means that Easter Sunday can occur on any Sunday between March  and April  Motheraposs Day shouldnapost be confused with the day in the US, which falls in May and has ious sources that helped to set it up. Why do we celebrate Motheraposs Day   There are ious reasons we celebrate Motheraposs Day, but it is now seen as a chance to be grateful to our mum for everything they have done for us over the years Until recently it was more commonly known as aposMothering Sundayapos. There were ancient Greek festivals that celebrated motherhood as well in honour of their god Rhea and festivals were also held by the Romans, so the tradition is nothing new. In Europe and the UK, a special service would see people ing to their aposmother churchapos during Lent. Like with other Christian holidays, such as Christmas and Easter, the day has become more of a secular tradition and widely commercialised.  In the US, abolitionist and suffragette Julia Ward Howe set up Mothers’ Friendship Day in the wake of the American Civil War in  to promote reconciliation with the mothers of Union and Confederate troops. In fact, Anna Jarvis, who pushed for the idea for Motheraposs Day to be celebrated in the US as part of the national calendar, eventually criticised the commercialisation of the day and lobbied to have it removed. Jarvis was the daughter of Ann Reeves Jarvis, who had set up work clubs for mums to come together. Anna had originally campaigned to have it as part of the national calendar and President Woodrow Wilson officially added it in . news uk-news mum-horried-after-mouse-spotted-"Liverpool: Mouse seen in the canteen of Kings Leadership AcademyByChris GrundyKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A mum has been left shocked after footage showed a mouse running through a school canteen. The video emerged from King’s Leadership Academy in Dingle Vale, Liverpool. Filmed by an anonymous student, it shows pupils trying to catch the rodent as it races between tables in the school’s cafeteria,The Liverpool Echo reported .Nicola Kelley has two children who attend the school, she said: It has been going on since before half term, when my kids were telling me about it, I didnapost believe it at first until I saw some of the videos. I thought that they would have fixed the problem over the school break, but obviously they havenapost.  I got in contact with them to tell them my concerns, and they came back to say that they saw two mice before the break, and that they thought the students were being dramatic, and that it wasnapost as bad as they were making out. The footage, filmed on March , shows only a single rodent racing around, but there were said to be “multiple” mice running around. The -year-old mum added: My daughter said that she saw at least five mice in the hall which is just outside the canteen yesterday [March ].  “I have had to start making them packed lunches, I donapost want them eating from in there. I ended chemo in November and finished radiotherapy in January, I am terried about my kids bringing any diseases home that these pests could carry, I donapost want to catch anything. The Echo also reported that two further mice were spotted at the school earlier.  A spokesperson for the King’s Leadership Academy Liverpool added: There was an incident last week where a mouse was seen within the canteen and our estate management team dealt with it immediately and the mouse was caught. Covid protocols requiring us to keep doors and windows open for ventilation presents challenges, particularly during the winter months, to stop incidents like this from happening. title: new variant proof cambridge university
story: New iant proof Cambridge University Covid jab receives backing worth millionsThe new "iant proof" coronavirus vaccine by Cambridge University has received global backing worth up to £million with PM Boris Johnson commending the projectMedical staff and volunteers prepare shots of the Moderna vaccine at an NHS Covid- vaccination centre Image: Getty ImagesByMartin BagotHealth and Science editor:,  Mar |commentsA new “iant proof” coronavirus vaccine by Cambridge University has received global backing worth millions of pounds.Prime Minister Boris Johnson hailed the project to develop the “NextGen” jab against known and future iants.He spoke via video link at the opening of a conference of the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovationsin London which is partnering with the university to make the jab. CEPI will invest up to £million towards a version of mRNA technology already used in Moderna and Pfizer jabs that could be quickly modied to target new pathogens. Mr Johnson said: “The UK is proud to have committed to a quarter of a billion pounds to support CEPI at the start of the pandemic, because it was precisely the partnership between CEPI, government, industry and academia which helped our vaccines to triumph over the virus.  “And now, we must come together to support CEPI’s global plan for the next generation of vaccine technologies, such as the new iant-proof vaccine being developed at Cambridge University to help protect us against the next Covid iant, or indeed, against the next pandemic.” DIOSynVax, a university spin-off company, is working with the structure of proteins, computational biology and on boosting the immune system to work out how vaccines can be used to their best effect. If the plan works, experts believe that vaccines could rapidly be developed against “Disease X” - unknown pathogens that have yet to emerge but which could cause pandemics.Dr Richard Hatchett, chief executive of CEPI, said: “The UK Government and the country’s world-leading scientic institutions have been pivotal to the global response to Covid-. “From the development of the CEPI-supported Oxford AstraZeneca vaccine - which is used in more countries than any other - to the ground-breaking Recovery trial to evaluate le-saving treatments like dexamethasone, British science has played a leading role in protecting the world from Covid-. “I am excited to further strengthen CEPI’s strong ties to British science through this partnership with DIOSynVax.” Professor Jonathan Heeney, chief executive of DIOSynVax, said: “Our approach is to be ahead of the next pandemic. “To deliver custom-designed, immune selected vaccine antigens - which is ideal to prevent diseases caused by complex viruses such as the large and erse family of coronaviruses. “If successful, it will result in a safe, affordable NextGen vaccine for widespread use.” England’s chief medical officer, Professor Sir Chris Whitty, told the CEPI conference the world had had many “near misses” with pandemics, and preparation for the next one was key. news uk-news prince-harry-meghan-markle-subjected-"Prince Harry offers continued support to those suffering in UkraineByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle were subjected to a level of cruelty by the royals who could have done more to accommodate them, a royal expert has claimed.The couple announced in early  they were stepping down as senior royals and have since quit the UK for a new le in America. It had been suggested that Harry and Meghan wanted to compromise with a one foot in, one foot out solution to being working royals and chasing their own financial deals.However, following the so-called Sandringham Summit between Harry, the Queen, Prince Charles and Prince William, it was decided they should cut ties completely.And now former BBC royal correspondent Peter Hunt says more could have been done to keep Harry and Meghan in the Firm - especially as Meghan could have been an asset to them. He told the: She was able to give a speech in South Africa about being a woman of colour who entered an institution that, to survive and prosper, needs to continue being the head of state in several other realms which are Commonwealth countries, and it failed to do enough to keep her within the institution.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .“I mean, it’s an institution that adjusts and makes things up as it goes along. There’s a flag up, there’s a flag down. They can adjust their history when they need to. They’ve managed to find a mechanism whereby [civilian] Prince Edward can attend the Cenotaph wearing a military unorm. They could have found a mechanism whereby Harry could have carried on. The fact that they didn’t smacks of a level of cruelty.”His comments come as Harry made a surprise appearance at a Texas rodeo - and came dressed for the occasion wearing a cowboy hat. Harry was spotted at the Stockyards Rodeo in Fort Worth, Texas, on Saturday - a famous rodeo where contestants ride bulls and take part in roping competitions. He was at the event without Meghan and was seen chatting to people attending the rodeo and was given a tour of the venue.Harryaposs appearance at the rodeo comes two weeks after his and Meghanaposs last public outing at the NAACP Image Awards, where they were awarded the prestigious Presidentaposs Award to mark their special achievement for aposdistinguished public serviceapos.Accepting the award, Harry said: I think itaposs safe to say that I come from a very dferent background from my incredible we, yet our lives were brought together for a reason. We share a commitment to a le of service, a responsibility to combat injustice and a belief that the most often overlooked are the most important to listen to. The couple also offered their support to the people of Ukraine amid the Russian invasion and Harry explained: Before I begin, we would like to acknowledge the people of Ukraine, who urgently need our continued support as a global community.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news serving-queens-guard--disappears-"Ukraine: British soldier Ben Grant leads troops in warByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A soldier who swore to protect the Queen with his le has ditched his post to fight in Ukraine. The -year-old Coldstream Guardsman quit his role in Windsor to take up arms fighting Vladimir Putin ’s forces in eastern Europe.The teenager is one of several Brits believed to have deserted their posts to join the war effort. Ministry of Defenceagents are believed to be attempting to find the teenager over fears Russia could see the soldier signing up as Britain joining the fighting.The move potentially threatens to undo progress made by the West to avoid the dire situation unravelling into a worldwide conflict.A source told The Sun he wrote to his parents before going AWOL.Follow the latest in Ukraine on our live blog  The insider said: “He’d had enough. He got promised a tour to Afghanistan, same as a lot of other lads after all the ceremonial stuff. But that didn’t happen. “A lot of the lads are fed up. They were promised an operational tour and it got pushed under their noses for about three or four years. Then when the tour was supposed to come about, it got cancelled. “He probably thinks he could do some good out there but it’s a very misguided decision.” Several of the army’s top brass has slammed the teen’s decision to leave his post.It comes as Foreign Secretary Liz Truss told the BBC she supported Brits going to fight in Ukraine. She said: “That is something people can make their own decisions about. “The people of Ukraine are fighting for freedom and democracy, not just for Ukraine but for the whole of Europe. “Absolutely,people want to support that struggle I would support them in doing that.”Defence secretary Ben Wallace later claried only Brits with military experience and who are no longer in the British Armed Forces should consider joining the war effort. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky earlier called on soldiers around the world to boost his army’s numbers by creating an “international legion”. Last week he revealed more than , foreigners had volunteered to fight. He said: “We have nothing to lose but our own freedom.” A spokesman for the MOD said: “All Service Personnel are prohibited from travelling to Ukraine until further notice. “This applies whether the Service Person is on leave or not. Personnel travelling to Ukraine will face disciplinary and administrative consequences.” Buckingham Palace was approached for comment. title: squid named joe biden weird
story: Squid named Joe Biden is weird prehistoric primitive vampire with  armsSyllipsimopodi bideni was armed with two more limbs than its descendants today and roamed the oceans  million years ago - he was named after US President Joe Biden to mark the moment of optimism of his inaugurationA host of strange animals have been named after Joe Bidens predecessors - including the tiny moth Neopalpa donaldtrumpi Image: Getty ImagesByMark WaghornRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A weird prehistoric squid with ten arms has been named after US President Joe Biden.The creature is the oldest ancestor of cephalopods - which also include octopae. Syllipsimopodi bideni was armed with two more limbs than its descendants today. It roamed the oceans  million years ago. Additional appendages would have made it a more efficient predator, say the team at the American Museum of Natural History in New York.The species was unearthed at the Mississippian Bear Gulch in Montana - one of the best preserved fossil sites in the world.It was a primitive vampire squid. They do not suck or drink blood but have dark skin that connects the arms - resembling a cape. The discovery sheds fresh light on evolution - pushing back the age of the group by nearly  million years.What do you make of squid Joe Biden  Have your say in the comment section Lead author Dr Christopher Whalen said: This is the first and only known vampyropod to possess ten al appendages. The paper was submitted for publication in Nature Communications around the time of the  year-old US presidentaposs inauguration. Dr Whalen said: I wanted to somehow acknowledge the moment in a way that was more positive and forward-looking. I was encouraged by the plans President Biden put forward to counter anthropogenic climate change, and his general sentiment that politicians should listen to scientists. Vampyropods are the ancestors of vampire squid and octopae. Their origins are unclear. Modern descendants have eight arms and two big eyes - enabling them to survive in pitch black waters near the bottom of the ocean. Octopae and squid can reach  and  feet long respectively - and weigh half a ton.  S. bideni was less than five inches showing they started out small - before becoming very big. Its remains are exceptionally important. The soft-bodied nature of cephalopods mean they rarely fossilise. Co-author Professor Neil Landman said: Syllipsimopodi may have filled a niche more similar to modern squids, a mid-level aquatic predator. It is not inconceivable it might have used its sucker-laden arms to pry small ammonoids out of their shells or ventured more inshore to prey on brachiopods, bivalves or other shelled marine animals. S. bideni was dug up in the s and donated to the Royal Ontario Museum in Canada where it has resided ever since - without previously being described. After scanning the specimen Dr Whalen and Prof Landman realised it was a completely new genus - and the oldest cephalopod on record. It corroborates previous arguments that their common ancestor had ten arms.Dr Whalen said: The arm count is one of the defining characteristics separating the -armed squid and cuttlefish line from the eight armed octopus and vampire squid line. We have long understood that octopuses achieve the eight arm count through elimination of the two filaments of vampire squid, and that these filaments are vestigial arms. However, all previously reported fossil vampyropods preserving the appendages only have  arms. So this fossil is arguably the first confirmation of the idea that all cephalopods ancestrally possessed ten arms. Two of S. bideniaposs arms appear to have been elongated relative to the other eight. Its torpedo-shaped body is reminiscent of todayaposs squids. The genus name is Greek for aposprehensile footapos because it is the oldest known cephalopod to develop suckers. They allowed the arms - modications of the molluscan foot - to better grasp prey and other objects. Added Dr Whalen: The findings present a revised and more detailed analysis of vampyropod evolution than previously possible. Joe Biden was inaugurated on  January last year. He is the th president of the United States. A host of strange animals have been named after his predecessors - including the tiny moth Neopalpa donaldtrumpi. The insectaposs yellow-and-white crown bore a striking resemblance to Donald J. Trumpaposs distinctive cofure. Baracktrema obamai is a species of flatworm that is meant to honour Barack Obama. The parasitic wasp Heterospilus washingtoni is named after George Washington, a tiny shrew Heterospilus washingtoni hails Theodore Roosevelt - and there is the bluegrass darter Etheostoma jimmycarter. Others include the beaded darter Etheostoma clinton after Bill Clinton and the wasp Heterospilus reagani after Ronald Reagan. title: uk weather forecast 70mph gales
story: UK weather forecast: mph gales, rain and snow to batter the country from todayA yellow warning has been issued by the Met Office as severe gales are predicted that could reach mph along with wind and snow in midweek for the west while it will be milder in the eastThe UK is set to be blasted by gale force winds Image: Colin Lane Liverpool EchoByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Brits are being warned of severe mph gales and snow for midweek with a mixture of frost and milder weather in an east-west ide.A low pressure front is sweeping in from the Atlantic bringing strong winds, rain and snow to the west of the country through Wednesday and Thursday while the weather will be brighter in the east and the mercury could rise to highs in the mid teens.The Met Office has issued a weather warning for north west Scotland that will run from am until am on Wednesday.It states: “Severe gales may lead to some disruption on Wednesday morning.” Adding people can expect: “Some delays to road, rail, air and ferry transport are likely. Probably some bus services affected with some journeys taking longer.”  Met Office forecaster Clare Nasir said: “Windy on Wednesday with gales towards the north west and also some heavy rain. Dry skies towards the south and the east.” She continued: “We could see severe gales for a time as the strongest winds extend to the far north of Scotland. We could even see some damaging gust across the east side of Northern Ireland again through the morning associated with that rain band with some heavy bursts.” At the same time it is likely to be a dry start to Wednesday across England and Wales before the rain moves in.  “This rain gradually pushes in and again these winds will be incredibly strong particularly through the north channel, said Ms Nasir. Now the cloud will come and go across England and Wales as well as eastern Scotland but some brighter weather, even some sunshine across eastern counties during the day. At the same time rain will slowly clip western part of Wales as well as the West Country, hanging onto that wet weather for Northern Ireland as well as western Scotland and an undercut of cold air will allow snow to fall especially above m. So west will see the strongest winds, outbreaks of rain, east temperatures will be C to C.  Maps from WXCharts shows that a couple of centimetres of snow can be expected in Scotland overnight going into Thursday.And BBC weather forecaster Nick Miller has also predicted snow that will come along with the gales.“Some severe gales, gusts up to -mph, could be disruptive before they ease,” he said.  This weather system weakens moving east over night and into Thursday on its back edge it will have some some snow towards the Highlands and southern uplands for a time. In the clear spells in north west Scotland and Northern Ireland as Thursday begins there will be a frost here and especially in Northern Ireland there is a risk of seeing some fog. UK forecast for the next  days Wet and windy in the west, drier in the east. Today: Low cloud across central, southern and eastern England breaking to allow sunny spells. A band of rain, heavy at times, will move slowly eastwards across Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales and then western England. Severe gales across western Scotland at first. Tonight: Outbreaks of rain across some northern and western parts, though rain turning lighter and patchier. Dry with clear spells in the southeast, and also the far northwest where turning frosty. Thursday: Cloudy across many parts with patchy light rain and drizzle edging slowly eastwards. Brighter across some western areas. Turning windy in the west later. Outlook for Friday to Sunday: Rather unsettled with outbreaks of rain at times for most parts of the UK, heaviest and most prolonged in western areas. Strong winds at times, especially along western coastal areas. title: well known tv couple unrecognisable
story: Well-known TV couple unrecognisable from unearthed s wedding photo to mark  yearsThe sentimental snap was shared by the couple to mark their th wedding anniversary but it left many saying they looked unrecognisable compared to todayThe cute snap was shared by the well known TV couple to celebrate their anniversaryByJoe Smith:,  Mar |comments A throwback wedding snap from the s left fans of this star couple open-mouthed after it came to light on Facebook. The sentimental snap was shared by the couple to mark their th wedding anniversary but it left many saying they looked unrecognisable compared to today.Buy canny fans might be able to make out the smiling faces of TV stars Sue and Noel Radford of the hit show “ Kids and Counting”.But the wedding pic, posted to commemorate their anniversary in , shows the couple looking totally dferent, so you’d be forgivenyou couldn’t make them out.Sue posted the touching image with the caption:  years ago today I married my soulmate.  Who would have thought  years later weaposd of just welcomed our th child into our family! I couldnapost love this man anymoreI tried. Happy silver wedding anniversary to us. Since those two fresh-faced lovebirds tied the knot they have welcomed a whopping  kids into the world, including another two just since that photo was posted on Facebook, bringing their total to  children and  grandchildren. The celeb couple are parents to Chris, , Sophie, , Chloe, , Jack, , Daniel, , Luke, , Millie, , Katie, , James, , Ellie, , Aimee, , Josh, , Max, , Tillie, , Oscar, , Casper, nine, Hallie, six, Phoebe, five, Archie, four, Bonnie, three, and Heidie, one.  Dad Noel supports the massive brood with his bakery business, The Radford Pie Company, which he launched in . Fans of Channel  show  Kids and Counting have followed the Lancashire based family and the day-to-day work of looking after such an army of kids. The Radfords have revealed that they run up massive weekly grocery bills to feed everyone, getting through four loaves of bread per day, plus  pints of milk per week as well as  toilet rolls. The Radford brood range in age from  all the way down to one-year-old.While some of the older children have moved out and started families of their own, the majority of the Radfords all live in an enormous ten-bedroom house in Morecambe.The huge family, who get around in their own minibus, have a luxury pad with cinema, hot tub and bar in their garden while Sue also has a £K Range Rover she uses when there are fewer kids in toe. news uk-news woman-who-met-raf-airman-"CCTV shows the last confirmed sighting of Corrie McKeagueBySam RussellGraeme Murray:,  Mar |comments A young woman who met RAF airman Corrie McKeague on a night out has told an inquest he mentioned walking home from Bury St Edmunds to his base. Mr McKeague, of Dunfermline, Fe, was  when he vanished in the early hours of September   after a night out in the Suffolk town.The airman was stationed at RAF Honington, more than eight miles from Bury St Edmunds. No trace of him has been found since a last sighting on CCTV at .am entering a service area behind a Greggs store, and Suffolk Police believe he climbed into a bin which was then tipped into a waste lorry. Alicia Gallagher, giving evidence to an inquest in Ipswich by video link, said she first met Mr McKeague on a night out in Bury St Edmunds in December .She said she was with her sister at Flex nightclub and saw a number of people who were in smart dress formal wear, like tuxes. One of them was on his own, she said. We were just out dancing really and he stayed with us for a couple of hours until closing. She continued: He was actually just really friendly. He wasnapost flirty. He was just really sociable - it was like he was looking for people to chat to.  She said that when they left, at around .am, she was taking a taxi with her sister in a dferent direction from Mr McKeague. My sister was concerned he wasnapost going home with anyone, said Ms Gallagher. We offered him some money for a taxi - he did mention a base but he didnapost say which base it was. He said he walked... one time which my sister wasnapost happy with. In the end I think he just wandered off.She continued: He said he had done it before, which I remember as we talked about it in the taxi home and said aposthataposs so farapos. Itaposs something I remember from that night as I thought aposthataposs so far, I wouldnapost do thatapos, but then Iaposm not a young, fit male either. It was a striking point that he mentioned walking home, that he had done it before. She said she saw Mr McKeague a second time on September   in Wetherspoons in Bury St Edmunds. She said she was with a friend for a casual drink when Mr McKeague, who did not recognise her, pulled up a chair. Ms Gallagher said he was very friendly, very confident. She said when she recognised him she found a video of him with her sister on the previous night out, showed it to him, then sent her sister a Snapchat video of Mr McKeague saying hello. She said he left after a few minutes. Aaron Figge, who worked in the Spar shop at RAF Honington, said in a statement that Mr McKeague bought a bottle of vodka from the shop on Friday, September  . He said Mr McKeague was among his regular customers who he became friendly with, describing him as a very happy, chatty person who was always well-presented and seemed a nice guy. I was aware he lived on the base as he was a regular customer, he said.  He asked to see ious bottles of vodka and while choosing he chatted to me, said Mr Figge. He stated he had not had a good day at work - this was not usual for Corrie as he was usually so upbeat. He said he believed Mr McKeague bought a cl bottle of Spar vodka, the cheapest bottle in the store, for between £ and £, and also bought cigarettes, paying by card. We said bye to each other and he left the shop, he said. The inquest, due to last for up to four weeks, continues. title: woman wins medal male dominated
story: Woman wins medal in male-dominated sport after being selected to represent GBFaye West has been selected to represent her country in the male-dominated sport of wheelchair rugby, and in a recent match in the European Championships she scored a silver medalFaye West is now competing in Team GBByJohn BettAudience WriterNino Robertson:,  Mar |commentsA woman has won a medal in a male-dominated sport after being selected to represent her country in an international competition.Faye West is just one of two women competing in wheelchair rugby in the European Championships, and now plays for Team GB alongside Paralympic Champion Kylie Grimes.They have now played in France and the -strong squad won a silver medal after being narrowly beaten by the home team, with a final score of -. Despite not winning her first tournament, Faye is excited to launch her career in one of the only full-contact disability sports - one that is also open to men and women competing on the same team. What do you about wheelchair rugby  Let us know in the comments....Speaking before the event, Faye, from Plymouth, Devon, said: It is a huge honour to be selected for GB, I am super excited to get stuck in and be part of an awesome squad. I can’t wait to start my rugby career at the Europeans - what a competition to have a debut! Faye, who plays for West Country Hawks, was the only female high-point player in the tournament, and last year Team GB claimed gold, grabbing the news headlines and making history. Ed Warner, chair of the team, said: Our success in Tokyo has deservedly brought more attention to this amazing sport and we are intent on using this increased awareness to further build our profile, introducing wheelchair rugby to more people, supporting the sport nationally at grassroots level and building our communities. The Mirror is committed to more hopeful news. We recognise the news agenda can sometimes feel overwhelmingly negative.And while itaposs our job to keep you informed and hold those in power to account, we are making a commitment to also report more hopeful news. We will celebrate the people, places and movements that are bringing good into the world and, more than that, we will dig beneath the surface of important issues with the aim of finding hope.We will be firm in our convictions - but always fair-minded. By sharing solutions to problems, we can do more good and feel better about the world around us. Because we believe you deserve it. #mirrormorehopefulFollow on Twitter @mirrormorehope And follow Mirror More Hopeful on FacebookFor more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Our mission statement is to lead, promote, grow and support wheelchair rugby for the enjoyment of all and I believe our new brand identity positions us as a world-class governing body that is on a mission to set the standard in participation, performance and promotion in disability sport. This design concept, created through a collaborative approach in consultation with our players, coaches and clubs, ensures wide-ranging appeal which in itself demonstrates the unique qualities of the sport and the energy that comes from within us all. title: kenyan hotel sas hero who
story: Kenyan hotel SAS hero who single handedly took on jihadis reveals his identitySAS hero Christian Craighead was the lone special-ops soldier who fought off a major terror attack at a Kenyan hotel in  - here he speaks publicly for the first time about that dayChristian Craighead on Evan Hafers podcastByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments The SAS hero who battled Kenyan hotel terrorists has spoken publicly for the first time, telling how being shot felt like banging your funny bone times by ,.The special forces veteran, known as Christian Craighead, revealed how his arm was once left hanging by the triceps after being hit by a bullet fired from a Dragunov sniper rle. Speaking on Evan Haferaposs Black Rle Coffee Podcast in the US, the decorated hero said: In the back of my mind Iaposm like aposIaposve been shot, thataposs coolapos, then thereaposs like aposI hope I donapost lose my armapos. Speaking with a hint of his Geordie accent, he went on: This is the strange thing. Now it hurt badly. When it goes through that bone. And I get it when people say when they get shot, they donapost feel it. I completely buy into thatit doesnapost go through a bone.  But once it goes through a bone and shatters it, it hurts. It was like banging your funny bone and times by ,. Thataposs what it felt like. But hereaposs the messed-up bit. Going back into junior para, being indoctrinated and things, there was a sense of satisfaction. It was like, aposoh, Iaposve just been shot, thataposs pretty coolapos. In the back of my mind, Iaposm like aposIaposve been shot, thataposs cool, then thereaposs like aposI hope I donapost lose my armapos. And my arm was hanging by the triceps but, having some medical knowledge. I could wriggle my fingers.And in my mind, again just thinking, thataposs not that bad because I can wriggle my fingers. In my mind, I was thinking, aposIaposm going to keep my armapos. He suffered a shattered humerus and now has a titanium rod implanted from his elbow to shoulder. Craighead added: I think most young soldiers, maybe, you kind of want to get shot because itaposs like a thing isnapost it, like aposoh Iaposve been shotapos. Itaposs a be careful what you wish for, isnapost it. And you kind of want it to happen, you want to be tested. And sometimes death is a price where you say aposdo you know what, I donapost mind dyingapos.  I think there are lots of people who havenapost seen combat who wouldaposve said aposI will sacrice my le to experience that combatapos. I think thataposs part of training, mindset, everything that comes to it. Craighead, who joined the army in  as a -year-old, was pictured in January  during the Nairobi hotel siege. He was in Kenya on a SAS mission to train local forces and was relaxing off-duty when Somali-based Al Shabaab militants attacked the Dusit D complex.He raced to the scene in his civvies, pulled on a camouflage flak jacket, then led a counter-attack armed with a Colt Canada C assault rle, Glock  pistol and combat kne. Wearing a balaclava and heavily armed, he almost single-handedly defeated jihadis, rescuing dozens. The -hour siege left  people dead, including British charity worker Luke Potter. It was only last year, Craighead, who won a Conspicuous Gallantry Cross, the UKaposs second-highest medal for his heroics, unmasked himself so he could publish an account of how he ended the terror attack. His move came after people kept impersonating him on social media and in pubs near the SASaposs Hereford base. Craigheadaposs decision to unmask himself sparked deep concern among senior or defence officials, worried he may reveal details of the missions he was involved in. Under strict rules, Special Forces troops must not discuss their operations publicly and seek to make money from revealing their details. The rules follow the furore over books by ex-troopers Chris Ryan and Andy McNab, which raised the SASapos public profile and led to concerns over Special Forces troops leaking sensitive information which could compromise future operations. Craigheadaposs book on the siege called One Man In: The Explosive Firsthand Account of the Lone Special-Ops Soldier Who Fought Off a Major Terrorist Attack in Kenyaapos, is expected to be published in June next year.Discussing the MOD rules and confidentiality issues, he said: Iaposm working with the Ministry of Defence as we speak to do it properly, to release this book, so thereaposs no sense of information or anything.So thataposs as far as Iaposm willing to talk about my le in the nd Special Air Service Regiment. I should add that the book is just about that one day, so for anyone on the edge of their seats, it doesnapost talk about anything I did while serving in the unit. It just talks about one thing I did that we all know I did. The Newcastle-born hero currently spends much of his time in the States as he is engaged to Donald Trumpaposs chief White House photographer Shealah Craighead. news weird-news inside-eerie-nuclear-bunker-cold-"Real footage of a Cold War nuclear bunkerByZahna EklundAudience writerRia Newman:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A brave explorer has uncovered a secret network of nuclear bunkers hidden in the Welsh countryside that were used during the Cold War, and have more recently become set pieces for an episode of Doctor Who. Jay Curtis, , stumbled upon the interesting find late last year when he noticed the network tucked away in the countryside in Brackla, Bridgend.And when the explorer, from Wales, investigated the area he found nuclear blast doors, as well as an air filtration system, generator and water and diesel storage. The bunkers also housed eight secret magazine tunnels that were built to protect the high explosives held within the Brackla Munitions Factory, where , people worked during the Second World War. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Jay explored the area and shared the find on his YouTube channel, Jay Curtis Explores, where he said: “Now this place might look like any ordinary industrial estate, but with the imminent Second World War upon Britain this place became one of the most secretive places in South Wales – and there’s plenty of other hidden history left overyou know where to look. “Inside the bunker is a maze of rooms for personnel, beds, a canteen, recreation, offices, communication centres – you name it. This bunker remains locked and forgotten in the hillside.”The Royal Ordnance Factory stopped production of the explosives in  and the site was left abandoned until the s, when the Ministry of Defenceturned part of the site into a nuclear command bunker for South Wales.While the bunker appears totally abandoned and reclaimed by nature, with leaves and plants growing up around it, Jay revealed it still has its own power supply.  Jay added: “You can tell by the well-maintained road and new locks that this place is very much still in use.” It is currently not clear who is using the site, but it has previously been used as a filming location for Doctor Who and Torchwood, where the crew was allowed access to film episodes featuring the iconic Cybermen villains. According to Jay, everything inside the locked bunkers remains “in full working order”. Standing outside the entrance, Jay explained: “That bizarre-looking square building behind me was in fact originally a magazine tunnel entrance, but this new entrance was added with the imminent threat of a nuclear attack – hence the air filtration system, the generator inside, the water and the diesel storage, and a series of nuclear blast doors.”  The magazine tunnels are also still intact and “scattered across the landscape”. Jay said: “Many have been filled in but two or three entrances above ground give an idea of what a secretive past this hillside once had. It’s in these dark magazine tunnels that thousands upon thousands of tonnes of explosives would be piled high to the ceiling, hidden away from the enemy and the threat from above.” And further down the hillside, Jay found the remains of more tunnels, with the main access and ventilation shafts now filled in.  Speaking after sharing his video, he said: “It was a complete surprise to find this as I went looking for evidence of the former munitions factory tunnels and did not expect to stumble across the bunkers in the woods. The feeling below ground was very eerie. You could hear nothing from le above ground. “The damp environment within the bunker offered little resemblance to its signicant past – just a chemical toilet, cupboard, some BT junction box and wiring, and the remains of the water pump could be found inside.”Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Viralproperty news" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news i-tattoo-tribute-beloved-dog-"TikTok: Tribute to dog tattoo failByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsItaposs fair to say that we all do things without giving it proper thought, whether itaposs impulsively getting a shorter than usual haircut, or spending our monthaposs wages on a new pair of trainers.However, one woman has been left in huge regret after getting a tattoo dedicated to her beloved dog, which ended up being nothing like what sheaposd actually asked for. Chey, who goes by the name @cumminschey on TikTok, has taken to the app to share a photo of the adorable inking she wanted, compared to what she actually received.The trainee teacher, from Ohio in the United States, revealed that the tattoo artist even drew a stencil of the artwork she wanted on her skin before doing the tattoo, yet it still turned out completely dferent. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.Didn’t they stencil it before to show you the design  a follower questioned, to which Chey replied: Yes but it looked completely opposite. Worst Iaposve spent, she wrote alongside the clip, which been watched nearly , times. One TikTok user commented: The detail and colour is amazing but this was NOT what you were going for lmao I get where youaposre coming from Iaposve had the same thing happen... Weaposve got to normalise being comfortable bringing up our issues with the stencil before they start, another added. A third wrote: These are two completely dferent concepts. In a follow up clip, it appears to show the tattoo having been covered up, although its unclear what design Chey decided to go with instead. One thing weaposre sure of is that she probably went to a dferent artist for that one...Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news mum-four-shocked-after-kids-"Liverpool: Mum finds snake on her bathroom floor in Norris GreenByAbigail NicholsonJoe Smith:,  Mar |comments A terried mum says she has been left unable to sleep after finding a giant snake on the floor of her bathroom. Kayleigh Ball, , described the horrying incident when her kids called her saying there was a snake in the bathroom and at first she assumed it was a toy. But the distressed mum-of-four soon realised her mistake when the creature on her bathroom floor began to writhe and squirm.Kayleigh said she has had trouble sleeping since finding the serpent in her Liverpool council home as it has since disappeared and she has no idea where it is.The -year-old told The ECHO : It was bedtime and I took the kids up to bed at around half seven when one of them started shouting apositaposs a snake in the bathroomapos. When I saw it I told them it was just a toy. I moved it lightly with my foot and it didnapost move. When my kid turned on the bathroom light, it started moving and I s*** myself. Itaposs skinny but itaposs huge, You find spiders and flies in your house, not a f*****g snake. Kayleigh closed the bathroom door and placed down a towel, covering the small gap between the door and the floor, before comforting her children and putting them to bed.  By the time she went back into the bathroom, she saw the snake go behind the back of her toilet. She continued: I saw it go behind the toilet and I havenapost seen it since. Iaposve since read they are attracted to dark places. I had to get a bath and I must have set a new world record for the quickest bath and hair wash ever. I was constantly checking the floor and the water to make sure the snake didnapost come back. title: mum left red faced after
story: Mum left red-faced after attempt to creep on handsome co-worker backfiresA mum has admitted to doing the most embarrassing thing after she tried to creep on her handsome co-worker and find out where he lives - as her plan backfiredThe woman detailed the most embarrassing thing shes ever doneImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments Workplace crushes arenapost uncommon, but you have to be careful when you navigate the world of dating on the job - especially when youaposre still trying to work outany romantic feelings are mutual. One woman on Mumsnet has found out just how tough it can be to try and be discreet with your office pining after she tried to creep on her handsome co-worker, only to have her covert operation completely backfire. The mum explained her colleague was on the phone with someone and had given them his postcode, which had prompted the woman to put the personal detail into her phoneaposs mapso she could find out where he lived.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. But instead of being silently creepy like she had hoped, her phone decided to plot against her - as she accidentally triggered the GPS within the map and a robotic voice told the entire office she was planning to head to her co-workeraposs house. In a post titled, To have done the most embarrassing thing ever, she explained: This happened about an hour ago and I think I need to go home and never come back to the office again. I work with a very very very handsome man. He was on the phone in the office this morning trying to sort out someone to come and fix his boiler. He happened to say his postcode and I, being the creepy wee lady I am, put it into maps on my phone to see where he lived.  For some reason, and I still donapost know why, my phone blared out: Starting route from aposcurrent locationapos to aposhandsome manaposs postcodeapos. I was  feet away in a quiet office. He turned to look and I couldn’t even look up for wanting the ground to swallow me whole. How do I come back from this  Commenters on the Mumsnet post were sympathetic to the mumaposs hilarious blunder, with many of them suggesting she style it out by just pretending her Siri picked up on his voice. One person said: Oh my god thataposs horrendous and something that would happen to me so I am dying for you. Definitely Siriaposs fault! As another suggested: Style it out. Siri must have picked him up saying his postcode. Really must remember to lock your phone before you put it in your bag... While others attempted to make her feel better by sharing their own embarrassing romance stories. Someone posted: Years ago, I was texting my friend about this boy I really liked and accidentally sent it to him. A few days later I saw him and he asked meI had something to tell him, and I said no and left it at that. And someone  wrote: In my teens when everyone smoked, I tried to casually impress a boy by pulling my cigarettes out of my bag without looking at them or him. I flipped the lid open shook them loose and said, aposHelp yourselfapos. He said aposEr no thanksapos. I had just offered him a selection of brightly wrapped mini tampons.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DatingRelationshipsUmm what Funny ha ha viral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: people think im weird live
story: People think Im weird as I live in an old peoples home aged  - I love itA TikToker has revealed how she moved into a retirement complex after struggling to find somewhere to live where she works - despite the fact shes only The -year-old couldnt be any happier in her accommodation Image: @playboylacroix TIKTOKByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsA -year-old has revealed how people find it bizarre that she genuinely lives in an old peopleaposs home, but she doesnapost care because she loves it.The woman, who posts on TikTok with the handle @playboylacroix, moved into a retirement complex after struggling to find any other accommodation in the town where she needs to be for work - but she doesnapost work in the home.She regularly takes to the app to give tours of her unusual living situation, where thereaposs regularly old ladies playing board games and free baked goods on offer. In fact, people in the complex are so welcoming, they regularly leave food on her door step for her coming in from work and people regularly lock their doors as its so safe. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. When asked by her followers how she ended up living in the accommodation, the woman explained that the town decided to open up the free apartments due to a lack of rental properties in the area. Because of the nature of my job, I need to be at work. And I travel a lot but it was impossible to find housing. So this town has a lot of people who come here for that reason, and they had no housing other than low income, she explained. So they started allowing people to live in their old folks home because it was one of their only rental units that would have openings. There’s a tech school in town and there’s a handful of about three or four people my age that live here, but  percent of the people that live here are still old folks because they live here since before the city bought it and allowed other people to live here. Itaposs still very much an old people’s home - I feel like Iaposm in Golden Girls. Cheap, spacious and safe, with free food and lovely, kind neighbours  Sign us up.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: shein customers horror 499 dress
story: Shein customers horror at £. dress that would only fit a five-year-oldDemi Brandord, , ordered a dress online and was excited to wear it out, but she was left disappointed as when it arrived it looked like it would fit a five-year-oldDemi Bradford suffered an epic shopping fail after buying a glam dress online Image: Caters News AgencyByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A shopper was left disappointed after ordering a glam dress online - because what arrived looked like it was made to fit a five-year-old. Demi Bradford, , said she suffered a shopping fail after buying the £. dress that was only available in one size, from SHEIN - a retailer she often uses.When it arrived, she was shocked that it looked so small - and when she placed it next to a one-litre bottle of water the two items looked about the same size. The teaching assistant from London claims that even though the dress had some give, there was no way she could wear it properly as it went completely see-through as it stretched so much.Demi, a teaching assistant, added: As soon as I lted the dress out of the package, I was positive that I must have been sent the wrong item. It was absolutely tiny! It looked like it would fit a five-year-old. I was positive that there was no way Iaposd be able to get the dress on. I ordered the light blue bodycon dress because Iaposd seen a few people wearing it on social media and I loved it.  I thought it would be a great outfit for when I go out with my friends. Itaposs a similar style to the clothes I wear, as I love glamourous bodycon dresses. I was really excited for the delivery to arrive so I could try the dress on. I loved the style. Demi said: The material of the dress was stretchy, but I didnapost think it would stretch so much that it would be able to fit me. But I decided to try the dress on and thataposs when things got worse.  When I eventually had the dress on, it was totally see-through! You could see absolutely everything. Because it was stretched so far, the material had gone from light blue to completely transparent. Thereaposs no way Iaposd ever be able to wear it out of the house. The colour looked a lot darker on the picture online and the material seemed like it would be a lot thicker over certain areas. The only similarities were the patterns on the dress, but other than it was nothing like I expected. I sent it to my friends and they all got a bit of a laugh out of it. But they were just as shocked as I was. They couldnapost believe how small the dress looked and agreed that there was no way it could be worn on a night out. SHEIN has been contacted for comment. title: woman perplexed boyfriend gives just
story: Woman perplexed as boyfriend gives her just because gt - but demands repaymentA woman has been left baffled after her boyfriend gave her concert tickets as a just because gt, but then demanded she pay him back the money he spent on themThe woman was left frustrated by her boyfriends actionsImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsUsually, when you give a present to someone you care about, you donapost expect anything in .But one woman on Reddit has been left completely flummoxed after her boyfriend approached her with a gt heaposd bought her just because he wanted to show her how much he loves her - but then demanded she pays him back. The woman posted her story anonymously and explained her boyfriend surprised her with concert tickets to see her favourite artist, which had initially left her really excited.Just moments later, though, her partner told her he expected her to give him the money to cover the cost of her ticket, despite him clearly stating it was a gt. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She said: Today, my boyfriend texted me that he had a surprise for me. After some time of guessing, he revealed that he bought two tickets to see my favourite singer in April. I was really excited because I’ve wanted to see this person in concert for the longest time, and I didn’t even know they were coming to my city. I asked my boyfriend why just out of curiosity, and he said it was a aposjust becauseapos gt. I was really excited until he said that I need to pay him back for my ticket. I was confused because I didn’t know that the artist was coming town let alone ask him to buy the tickets.  The woman said her boyfriend has been really pressing the issue of repayment and is so determined to get money from his girlfriend, that she has told him to just sell her ticket. She added: He’s really pressing the issue that I should pay him back. I told him that I shouldn’t have to because I never asked him to buy the tickets in the first place. He then goes on to say that I’m being ungrateful. I, not wanting to continue the conversation, told him that I don’t even want to go anymore and I asked him to seehe can get a refund for the ticketsor he can give my ticket to one of his friends. Commenters on Reddit were equally baffled by the manaposs reaction, as many people stated gts shouldnapost be something that requires repayment. One said: He should have asked first to seeyou wanted to buy a ticket. It isnapost a great surpriseit also comes with a surprise bill. While another wrote: If he expects you to pay him back, he has to tell you beforehand so you can decide. Whatit was something super expensive  Are you gonna go into thousands of dollars in debt because he got a luxurious trip for you two, but you have to pay half without knowing in advance  And a third added: He needs to look up the definition of gt in the dictionary. He also can’t obligate you to pay for something you didn’t request or know about.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RelationshipsUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
